info.title: GCOM API
info.description:
Grafana.com API (or GCOM). This documentation includes all endpoints of GCOM API including the staff ones.

Looking for GCOM API client packages? You can find them at [grafana-com-clients](https://github.com/grafana/grafana-com-clients) repository.

If you have any questions, please contact us at [#grafana-com-dev](https://raintank-corp.slack.com/archives/C0K031RP1) on Slack or open an issue
at [Grafana-com repository](https://github.com/grafana/grafana-com/issues/new).

This spec is in *Beta* stage, so use it with caution:
- Not all endpoint responses are properly typed for the time being.
- Some request parameter types may not be precise

excludeSynthetics.description:
This will be true if and only if Synthetics (API) rates should **NOT** be defaulted.

It will be the same value for all dimensions.
excludeSynthetics.title: excludeSynthetics

excludeInfra.description:
This will be true if and only if Kubernetes/Infra Observability rates should **NOT** be defaulted
(for both hosts and containers).

It will be the same value for all dimensions.
excludeInfra.title: excludeInfra

k6FractionalVUhReversion.description:
This will be true if and only if k6 Virtual User Hours should use metering mode fractional
rather than the usual fractional-v2.

Note that this is only if no k6 VUh SKU is present (using defaults), as the SKUs define the
metering mode.

It will be the same value for all dimensions.

id.description: A unique identifier of the session.
id.title: id

expiresAt.description: The date the session expires in [ISO8601](https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html) format. When not specified, the expiry date is set to 1 hour after session creation. You cannot set the session expiry to more than 24 hours after session creation.
expiresAt.title: expiresAt

sessionData.description: The payment session data you need to pass to your front end.
sessionData.title: sessionData

reference.description: The reference to uniquely identify a payment.
reference.title: reference

json.description: The `plugin.json` file is required for all plugins. When Grafana starts, it scans the plugin folders and mounts every folder that contains a `plugin.json` file unless the folder contains a subfolder named `dist`. In that case, Grafana mounts the `dist` folder instead.

id.description: Unique name of the plugin. If the plugin is published on grafana.com, then the plugin `id` has to follow the naming conventions.
id.title: id

info.description: Metadata for the plugin. Some fields are used on the plugins page in Grafana and others on grafana.com if the plugin is published.

url.description: Link to author's website.
url.title: url

time.description: Time when the plugin was built, as a Unix timestamp.
time.title: time

branch.description: Git branch the plugin was built from.
branch.title: branch

hash.description: Git hash of the commit the plugin was built from
hash.title: hash

pr.description: GitHub pull request the plugin was built from
pr.title: pr

build.description: Build job number used to build this plugin.
build.title: build

description.description: Description of plugin. Used on the plugins page in Grafana and for search on grafana.com.
description.title: description

keywords.description: Array of plugin keywords. Used for search on grafana.com.
keywords.title: keywords

links.description: An array of link objects to be displayed on this plugin's project page in the form `{name: 'foo', url: 'http://example.com'}`

name.description:
Display name of the link. Special names with predefined behavior:
`documentation` - sets Documentation link on plugins detail page
`repository` - used to determine and link to repository of the plugin
`license` - sets License link on plugins detail page
`raise issue` - sets `Raise an Issue` link on plugins detail page
`sponsorship` - sets `Sponsor this developer` link on plugins detail page to direct users to how they can support your work
name.title: name

url.description: URL value to use for this specific link.
url.title: url

target.description: A string that indicates where to display the linked resource
target.title: target

links.title: links

logos.description: SVG images that are used as plugin icons.

small.description: Link to the "small" version of the plugin logo, which must be an SVG image. "Large" and "small" logos can be the same image.
small.title: small

large.description: Link to the "large" version of the plugin logo, which must be an SVG image. "Large" and "small" logos can be the same image.
large.title: large

logos.title: logos

screenshots.description: An array of screenshot objects in the form `{name: 'bar', path: 'img/screenshot.png'}`
screenshots.title: screenshots

updated.description: Date when this plugin was built.
updated.title: updated

info.title: info

name.description: Human-readable name of the plugin that is shown to the user in the UI.
name.title: name

dependencies.description: Dependency information related to Grafana and other plugins.

grafanaVersion.description: (Deprecated) Required Grafana version for this plugin, e.g. `6.x.x 7.x.x` to denote plugin requires Grafana v6.x.x or v7.x.x.
grafanaVersion.title: grafanaVersion

grafanaDependency.description: Required Grafana version for this plugin. Validated using https://github.com/npm/node-semver.
grafanaDependency.title: grafanaDependency

plugins.description: An array of required plugins on which this plugin depends. Only non-core (that is, external plugins) have to be specified in this list.
plugins.title: plugins

extensions.description: Plugin extensions that this plugin depends on.

exposedComponents.description: An array of exposed component ids that this plugin depends on.
exposedComponents.title: exposedComponents

extensions.title: extensions

dependencies.title: dependencies

$schema.description: Schema definition for the plugin.json file. Used primarily for schema validation.
$schema.title: $schema

alerting.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports alerting. Requires `backend` to be set to `true`.
alerting.title: alerting

annotations.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports annotation queries.
annotations.title: annotations

autoEnabled.description: Set to true for app plugins that should be enabled and pinned to the navigation bar in all orgs.
autoEnabled.title: autoEnabled

backend.description: If the plugin has a backend component.
backend.title: backend

buildMode.description: The build mode of the plugin. This field is set automatically at build time, so it should not be provided manually.
buildMode.title: buildMode

builtIn.description: [internal only] Indicates whether the plugin is developed and shipped as part of Grafana. Also known as a 'core plugin'.
builtIn.title: builtIn

category.description: Plugin category used on the Add data source page.
category.title: category

healthDiagnosticsErrors.description: Enable/Disable health diagnostics errors. Requires Grafana >=7.5.5.
healthDiagnosticsErrors.title: healthDiagnosticsErrors

executable.description: The first part of the file name of the backend component executable. There can be multiple executables built for different operating system and architecture. Grafana will check for executables named `<executable>_<$GOOS>_<lower case $GOARCH><.exe for Windows>`, e.g. `plugin_linux_amd64`. Combination of $GOOS and $GOARCH can be found here: https://golang.org/doc/install/source#environment.
executable.title: executable

hideFromList.description: [internal only] Excludes the plugin from listings in Grafana's UI. Only allowed for `builtIn` plugins.
hideFromList.title: hideFromList

uid.description: Unique identifier of the included resource
uid.title: uid

component.description: (Legacy) The Angular component to use for a page.
component.title: component

role.description: The minimum role a user must have to see this page in the navigation menu.
role.title: role

action.description: The RBAC action a user must have to see this page in the navigation menu. **Warning**: unless the action targets the plugin, only the action is verified, not what it applies to.
action.title: action

addToNav.description: Add the include to the navigation menu.
addToNav.title: addToNav

defaultNav.description: Page or dashboard when user clicks the icon in the side menu.
defaultNav.title: defaultNav

icon.description: Icon to use in the side menu. For information on available icon, refer to [Icons Overview](https://developers.grafana.com/ui/latest/index.html?path=/story/docs-overview-icon--icons-overview).
icon.title: icon

logs.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports logs. It may be used to filter logs only features.
logs.title: logs

metrics.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports metric queries. Used to enable the plugin in the panel editor.
metrics.title: metrics

multiValueFilterOperators.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports multi value operators in adhoc filters.
multiValueFilterOperators.title: multiValueFilterOperators

pascalName.description: [internal only] The PascalCase name for the plugin. Used for creating machine-friendly identifiers, typically in code generation. If not provided, defaults to name, but title-cased and sanitized (only alphabetical characters allowed).
pascalName.title: pascalName

preload.description: Initialize plugin on startup. By default, the plugin initializes on first use, but when preload is set to true the plugin loads when the Grafana web app loads the first time. Only applicable to app plugins. When setting to `true`, implement [frontend code splitting](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/get-started/best-practices#app-plugins) to minimise performance implications.
preload.title: preload

queryOptions.description: For data source plugins. There is a query options section in the plugin's query editor and these options can be turned on if needed.

maxDataPoints.description: For data source plugins. If the `max data points` option should be shown in the query options section in the query editor.
maxDataPoints.title: maxDataPoints

minInterval.description: For data source plugins. If the `min interval` option should be shown in the query options section in the query editor.
minInterval.title: minInterval

cacheTimeout.description: For data source plugins. If the `cache timeout` option should be shown in the query options section in the query editor.
cacheTimeout.title: cacheTimeout

iam.description: Grafana reads the Identity and Access Management section and initializes a service account for the plugin, with a tailored set of [Grafana RBAC permissions](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/administration/roles-and-permissions/access-control/custom-role-actions-scopes/#rbac-permissions-actions-and-scopes). Grafana will share the service account's bearer token with the plugin backend using the `GF_PLUGIN_APP_CLIENT_SECRET` environment variable. Requires Grafana version 10.3.0 or later. Currently, this is behind the `externalServiceAccounts` feature toggle. To try this feature out, follow this [guide](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/how-to-guides/app-plugins/implement-rbac-in-app-plugins).

component.description: (Legacy) The Angular component to use for a page.
component.title: component

role.description: The minimum role a user must have to see this page in the navigation menu.
role.title: role

action.description: The RBAC action a user must have to see this page in the navigation menu. **Warning**: unless the action targets the plugin, only the action is verified, not what it applies to.
action.title: action

addToNav.description: Add the include to the navigation menu.
addToNav.title: addToNav

defaultNav.description: Page or dashboard when user clicks the icon in the side menu.
defaultNav.title: defaultNav

icon.description: Icon to use in the side menu. For information on available icon, refer to [Icons Overview](https://developers.grafana.com/ui/latest/index.html?path=/story/docs-overview-icon--icons-overview).
icon.title: icon

logs.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports logs. It may be used to filter logs only features.
logs.title: logs

metrics.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports metric queries. Used to enable the plugin in the panel editor.
metrics.title: metrics

multiValueFilterOperators.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports multi value operators in adhoc filters.
multiValueFilterOperators.title: multiValueFilterOperators

pascalName.description: [internal only] The PascalCase name for the plugin. Used for creating machine-friendly identifiers, typically in code generation. If not provided, defaults to name, but title-cased and sanitized (only alphabetical characters allowed).
pascalName.title: pascalName

preload.description: Initialize plugin on startup. By default, the plugin initializes on first use, but when preload is set to true the plugin loads when the Grafana web app loads the first time. Only applicable to app plugins. When setting to `true`, implement [frontend code splitting](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/get-started/best-practices#app-plugins) to minimise performance implications.
preload.title: preload

queryOptions.description: For data source plugins. There is a query options section in the plugin's query editor and these options can be turned on if needed.

maxDataPoints.description: For data source plugins. If the `max data points` option should be shown in the query options section in the query editor.
maxDataPoints.title: maxDataPoints

minInterval.description: For data source plugins. If the `min interval` option should be shown in the query options section in the query editor.
minInterval.title: minInterval

cacheTimeout.description: For data source plugins. If the `cache timeout` option should be shown in the query options section in the query editor.
cacheTimeout.title: cacheTimeout

queryOptions.title: queryOptions

routes.description: For data source plugins. Proxy routes used for plugin authentication and adding headers to HTTP requests made by the plugin. For more information, refer to [Authentication for data source plugins](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/how-to-guides/data-source-plugins/add-authentication-for-data-source-plugins).

path.description: For data source plugins. The route path that is replaced by the route URL field when proxying the call.
path.title: path

method.description: For data source plugins. Route method matches the HTTP verb like `GET` or `POST`. Multiple methods can be provided as a comma-separated list.
method.title: method

url.description: For data source plugins. Route URL is where the request is proxied to.
url.title: url

reqAction.description: The RBAC action a user must have to use this route. **Warning**: unless the action targets the plugin (or a nested datasource plugin), only the action is verified, not what it applies to.
reqAction.title: reqAction

headers.description: For data source plugins. Route headers adds HTTP headers to the proxied request.
headers.title: headers

body.description: For data source plugins. Route headers set the body content and length to the proxied request.
body.title: body

tokenAuth.description: For data source plugins. Token authentication section used with an OAuth API.

url.description: URL to fetch the authentication token.
url.title: url

scopes.description: The list of scopes that your application should be granted access to.
scopes.title: scopes

params.description: Parameters for the token authentication request.

client_secret.description: OAuth client secret. Usually populated by decrypting the secret from the SecureJson blob.
client_secret.title: client_secret

params.title: params

tokenAuth.title: tokenAuth

jwtTokenAuth.description: For data source plugins. Token authentication section used with an JWT OAuth API.

url.description: URL to fetch the JWT token.
url.title: url

scopes.description: The list of scopes that your application should be granted access to.
scopes.title: scopes

params.description: Parameters for the JWT token authentication request.
params.title: params

jwtTokenAuth.title: jwtTokenAuth

urlParams.description: Add URL parameters to a proxy route
urlParams.title: urlParams

routes.title: routes

skipDataQuery.description: For panel plugins. Hides the query editor.
skipDataQuery.title: skipDataQuery

streaming.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports streaming. Used in Explore to start live streaming.
streaming.title: streaming

tracing.description: For data source plugins, if the plugin supports tracing. Used for example to link logs (e.g. Loki logs) with tracing plugins.
tracing.title: tracing

iam.description: Grafana reads the Identity and Access Management section and initializes a service account for the plugin, with a tailored set of [Grafana RBAC permissions](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/latest/administration/roles-and-permissions/access-control/custom-role-actions-scopes/#rbac-permissions-actions-and-scopes). Grafana will share the service account's bearer token with the plugin backend using the `GF_PLUGIN_APP_CLIENT_SECRET` environment variable. Requires Grafana version 10.3.0 or later. Currently, this is behind the `externalServiceAccounts` feature toggle. To try this feature out, follow this [guide](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/how-to-guides/app-plugins/implement-rbac-in-app-plugins).

permissions.description: Permissions are the permissions that the plugin needs its associated service account to have to query Grafana.

scope.description: The scope that the plugin needs to access e.g: `teams:*`.
scope.title: scope

permissions.title: permissions

iam.title: iam

roles.description: List of RBAC roles defined by the plugin and their default assignments to basic roles (`Viewer`, `Editor`, `Admin`, `Grafana Admin`). Requires Grafana version 9.4.0 or later.

role.description: A role groups your plugin's related RBAC permissions (ex: `Projects Admin` would group permissions to create, read, write and delete projects). The RBAC actions defined in your role must start with your plugin `id` (ex: `grafana-test-app.projects:read`).

description.description: Describes the aim of the role.
description.title: description

role.title: role

grants.description: Default assignments of the role to Grafana basic roles (`Viewer`, `Editor`, `Admin`, `Grafana Admin`).
grants.title: grants

roles.title: roles

extensions.description: Plugin extensions are a way to extend either the UI of core Grafana or other plugins.

addedComponents.description: This list must contain all component extensions that your plugin registers to other extension points using [`.addComponent()`](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/reference/ui-extensions-reference/ui-extensions#addcomponent). **Components that are not listed here won't work.**

targets.description: The extension point ids your plugin registers the extension to, e.g. `["grafana/user/profile/tab"]`

title.description: The title of your component extension.

addedLinks.description: This list must contain all link extensions that your plugin registers to other extension points using [`.addLink()`](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/reference/ui-extensions-reference/ui-extensions#addlink). **Links that are not listed here won't work.**

targets.description: The extension point ids your plugin registers the extension to, e.g. `["grafana/dashboard/panel/menu"]`

addedFunctions.description: This list must contain all function extensions that your plugin registers to other extension points using [`.addedFunctions()`](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/reference/ui-extensions-reference/ui-extensions#addfunction). **Functions that are not listed here won't work.**

targets.description: The extension point ids your plugin registers the extension to, e.g. `["grafana/dashboard/panel/menu"]`
targets.title: targets

title.description: The title of your function extension.

description.description: Additional information about your function extension.
description.title: description

exposedComponents.description: This list must contain all components that your plugin exposes using [`.exposeComponent()`](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/reference/ui-extensions-reference/ui-extensions#exposecomponent). **Components that are not listed here won't work.**

id.description: A unique identifier for your exposed component. This is used to reference the component in other plugins. It must be in the following format: `{PLUGIN_ID}/name-of-component/v1`. It is recommended to add a version suffix to prevent future breaking changes. E.g.: `myorg-extensions-app/exposed-component/v1`.
id.title: id

title.description: The title of your exposed component.

description.description: Additional information about your exposed component.

extensionPoints.description: This list must contain all extension points that your plugin defines using [`usePluginLinks()`](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/reference/ui-extensions-reference/ui-extensions#usepluginlinks) or [`usePluginComponents()`](https://grafana.com/developers/plugin-tools/reference/ui-extensions-reference/ui-extensions#useplugincomponents). **Extension points that are not listed in here won't work.**

id.description: A unique identifier for your extension point. This is used to reference the extension point in other plugins. It must be in the following format: `{PLUGIN_ID}/name-of-my-extension-point/v1`. It is recommended to add a version suffix to prevent future breaking changes. E.g.: `myorg-extensions-app/extension-point/v1`.
id.title: id

languages.description: The list of languages supported by the plugin. Each entry should be a locale identifier in the format `language-COUNTRY` (for example `en-US`, `es-ES`, `de-DE`).
languages.title: languages

json.title: json

excludeSynthetics.description:
This will be true if and only if Synthetics (API) rates should **NOT** be defaulted.

It will be the same value for all dimensions.
excludeSynthetics.title: excludeSynthetics

excludeInfra.description:
This will be true if and only if Kubernetes/Infra Observability rates should **NOT** be defaulted
(for both hosts and containers).

It will be the same value for all dimensions.
excludeInfra.title: excludeInfra

k6FractionalVUhReversion.description:
This will be true if and only if k6 Virtual User Hours should use metering mode fractional
rather than the usual fractional-v2.

Note that this is only if no k6 VUh SKU is present (using defaults), as the SKUs define the
metering mode.

It will be the same value for all dimensions.
k6FractionalVUhReversion.title: k6FractionalVUhReversion
